story:
Once upon a time, in a small village in the beautiful mountains of Tajikistan, there lived a kind and curious little boy named Farid. Farid loved to explore the world around him and learn new things. He would often ask his parents and grandparents questions about the village, the mountains, and the stars in the sky.

One day, Farid asked his grandfather, "Babajan, why do the mountains around our village look so beautiful and majestic?"

Babajan smiled and replied, "My dear Farid, the mountains are home to the magical Snow Leopards, who are the guardians of the mountains. They are called the 'Simurgh' in our ancient legends, and they have the power to make the mountains look even more beautiful and majestic."

Farid's eyes widened with excitement. "Snow Leopards? Babajan, can we see them? I want to meet them and learn from them!"

Babajan chuckled and said, "The Snow Leopards are elusive and rarely seen, my dear Farid. But, if you are very lucky and deserve it, they may just grace you with their presence."

Farid was determined to see the Snow Leopards and prove himself worthy. He decided to be the kindest and most helpful person in the village. He would help his parents with their chores, assist his neighbors, and even clean up the village square. He did all of this with a smile on his face and a kind word for everyone.

Days turned into weeks, and weeks turned into months, but Farid's determination never wavered. He continued to be kind and helpful, and his good deeds spread throughout the village like wildfire.

One cold winter night, as Farid was gazing up at the star-studded sky, he saw a faint movement in the distance. He rubbed his eyes and looked again. To his surprise, he saw three beautiful Snow Leopards, standing tall and proud on the peak of the highest mountain.

Farid couldn't believe his eyes. He had never seen anything so magnificent in his entire life. He felt a sense of peace and tranquility wash over him as he watched the Snow Leopards. They seemed to be watching him too, as if they were acknowledging his kind and helpful nature.

From that day on, Farid knew that the Snow Leopards were always watching over him, guiding him, and blessing him with their presence. He continued to be kind and helpful, and the Snow Leopards continued to grace him with their presence, reminding him of the beauty and majesty of the world around him.

And so, Farid learned that kindness and helpfulness are the keys to unlocking the beauty and magic of the world. And with that lesson in his heart, he drifted off to sleep, dreaming of the majestic Snow Leopards and the beautiful mountains of Tajikistan.

Goodnight, my dear child. May you always be kind, helpful, and blessed with the beauty and magic of the world.
